"... you're not supposed to actually call vkAllocateMemory for every individual buffer. ... The right way to allocate memory for a large number of objects at the same time is to create a custom allocator that splits up a single allocation among many different objects by using the offset parameters that we've seen in many functions." </dd> <dt>\anchor _todo000002 \_setscope Vkx::Image Member \_internalref class_vkx_1_1_image#ad79534db0b08ea7e9312e2c20425729a "Vkx::Image::Image" (std::shared_ptr< Device > device, vk::ImageCreateInfo const &info, vk::MemoryPropertyFlags memoryProperties, vk::ImageAspectFlags aspect)</dt><dd> "... you're not supposed to actually call vkAllocateMemory for every individual image. ...
